org.fruit.alayer

Interface Taggable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Action, State, SUT, Widget
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActivateSystem, CompoundAction, KeyAction, KeyDown, KeyUp, KillProcess, MouseDown, MouseGesture, MouseMove, MouseUp, NOP, StdState, StdWidget, SUTBase, TaggableBase, Type, Wait

    public interface Taggable
    Taggable's are a essential part of the FRUIT library. A taggable object can carry Tag's which convey information about it. Action's State's and SUT's are taggable. For example: A widget has many tags such as Enabled, Role and Shape attached it. You can also add additional tags to or remove specific ones from a taggable object. You can think of Taggable's as Java's Map's. The difference is that they can contain objects of different types, yet type safety is still enforced.
    See Also:
    Tag, SUT, State, Action

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      <T> T get(Tag<T> tag, T defaultValue)
      Retrieves the value of tag or returns defaultValue if the tag is not attached to this object.
      void remove(Tag<?> tag)
      Removes tag and its value from this object
      <T> void set(Tag<T> tag, T value)
      Attach tag to this object and associate it with value
      java.lang.Iterable<Tag<?>> tags()
      Returns an Iterable over all tags currently attached to this object.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        <T> T get(Tag<T> tag)
   throws NoSuchTagException
        Retrieves the value of tag if it is attached to this object. If this object does not have the corresponding tag, then this method throws a NoSuchTagException
        Parameters:
        tag - tag to retrieve
        Returns:
        the value associated with tag
        Throws:
        NoSuchTagException - if the tag is not attached to this object

      • get

        <T> T get(Tag<T> tag,
          T defaultValue)
        Retrieves the value of tag or returns defaultValue if the tag is not attached to this object.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag for which to retrieve the value
        defaultValue - the value that is returned if the tag is not available
        Returns:
        the value associated with tag or defaultValue.

      • tags

        java.lang.Iterable<Tag<?>> tags()
        Returns an Iterable over all tags currently attached to this object.
        Returns:
        Iterable over all attached tags

      • set

             T value)
        Attach tag to this object and associate it with value
        Parameters:
        tag - tag to attach to this object
        value - the value to associate with tag

      • remove

        void remove(Tag<?> tag)
        Removes tag and its value from this object
        Parameters:
        tag - tag to remove
